snippet: The base defense budget for 2016 exceeds by $35 billion the mandatory across-the-board reductions known as sequestration, and President Obama is asking for an additional $51 billion for operations in Iraq, Syria and Afghanistan.
abstract: Pentagon says Pres Obama is seeking base defense budget of $534 billion in 2016, surpassing mandatory sequestration cuts by $35 billion; says in addition he is asking for extra $51 billion for Iraq and Syria conflicts, as well as ongoing American military contingent in Afghanistan.
lead_paragraph: The base defense budget for 2016 exceeds by $35 billion the mandatory across-the-board reductions known as sequestration, and President Obama is asking for an additional $51 billion for operations in Iraq, Syria and Afghanistan.

headline.main: Obama’s Defense Budget Aims Higher, and at Overseas Conflicts
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Defense Budget Aims Higher, and at Overseas Conflicts

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
